meta.name: Upwork Lead Generation: Extract Client Emails with LinkedIn Scraping and AI

nodes.name: Extract Company or Person Name from Job

options.systemMessage: "Extract the client's name or company name if it is mentioned. Return only the name or 'null' if not found."

nodes.name: Is It a Person or Company?

options.systemMessage: "Extract the client's name or company name. Return only the 'person' if looks like a person's name if not return 'company'."

parameters.content:
=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# üöÄ **Automated Upwork Lead Enrichment Workflow**

> ‚ú® *Fetch potential clients from Upwork, extract their info using AI, search them on LinkedIn, gather emails, and store all in Google Sheets* ‚ú®

---

## üß© **1. Trigger & Data Collection**

---

### ‚è∞ `Trigger - Run Every X Hours`

**üîß Node Type**: Schedule Trigger
**üß† Purpose**:
This node starts your automation periodically. You define how often it runs (e.g., every 6 hours, daily, etc.).

**üìö Why It‚Äôs Important**:
You don‚Äôt want to manually check Upwork every few hours. This node automates it for you.

---

### üåê `Fetch Latest Upwork Jobs (Apify)`

**üîß Node Type**: HTTP Request
**üß† Purpose**:
Fetch the latest Upwork jobs by calling the [Apify Upwork Actor API](https://apify.com/).

**‚öôÔ∏è Tech Behind It**:
A simple `GET` request pulls in structured job listings (title, description, budget, etc.) as JSON data.

**üí° Beginner Tip**:
No coding needed‚Äîjust copy your Apify API URL with your token and plug it into the node.

---

## ü§ñ **2. AI Name Extraction**

---

### üß† `AI - Extract Company or Person Name from Job`

**üîß Node Type**: AI Agent / OpenAI Chat
**üß† Purpose**:
Uses GPT to scan the job title + description and extract a **company name or client‚Äôs full name**, if present.

**üìö Why It‚Äôs Smart**:
Clients sometimes mention names like ‚ÄúHi, we at DevSync...‚Äù or sign with their name at the bottom. This step grabs that.

**üß† AI Prompt Tip**:
Use structured prompts like:

> ‚ÄúExtract a full person or company name from this job description. If not found, say 'none‚Äô.‚Äù

---

### üß™ `IF - Name is Found?`

**üîß Node Type**: IF
**üß† Purpose**:
Checks whether the AI returned a name. If not, it skips that job.

**üõë `No Name Found - End Early`**
Stops further processing and prevents wasted API calls or errors.

---

## üß≠ **3. AI Classification ‚Äì Person vs Company**

---

### üß† `AI - Is It a Person or Company?`

**üîß Node Type**: AI Agent
**üß† Purpose**:
Classifies the extracted name as either a **company** or a **person** using simple AI logic.

**üîç Why It Matters**:
Depending on what it is, the next step‚Äîsearching LinkedIn‚Äîwill differ.

---

### üîÄ `IF - Person or Company?`

**üîß Node Type**: IF
**üß† Purpose**:
Routes the flow to two different paths:

* Company ‚Üí Search company profile
* Person ‚Üí Search individual profile

---

## üè¢ **4A. Company Path**

---

### üîç `Search LinkedIn for Company (Phantombuster)`

**üîß Node Type**: HTTP Request
**üì° Purpose**:
Uses [Phantombuster‚Äôs LinkedIn Search API](https://phantombuster.com/) to search for the **company name**.

**üì¶ Input**: `"DevSync"`
**üì§ Output**: Company‚Äôs LinkedIn URL

---

### üè≠ `Scrape LinkedIn Company Profile`

**üîß Node Type**: HTTP Request
**üîç Purpose**:
Scrapes the company‚Äôs LinkedIn page to pull:

* Size
* Website
* Industry
* Location
* Description

---

### üì¨ `Find Company Email (Hunter.io)`

**üîß Node Type**: HTTP Request
**üîç Purpose**:
Uses [Hunter.io](https://hunter.io) to find company-level email addresses like `info@devsync.com`, `hello@devsync.com`, etc.

**üì¶ Input**: Company‚Äôs domain (e.g., `devsync.com`)
**üì§ Output**: Emails + Confidence Score

---

## üë§ **4B. Person Path**

---

### üîç `Search LinkedIn for Person (Phantombuster)`

**üîß Node Type**: HTTP Request
**üì° Purpose**:
Searches for the extracted **person‚Äôs name** like "John Smith" using Phantombuster.

**üì§ Output**: LinkedIn profile URL(s)

---

### üßë‚Äçüíº `Scrape LinkedIn Person Profile`

**üîß Node Type**: HTTP Request
**üìÑ Purpose**:
Scrapes:

* Name
* Current Job Title
* Company
* Location
* Education
* LinkedIn URL

---

### ‚úâÔ∏è `Find Personal Email (Hunter.io)`

**üîß Node Type**: HTTP Request
**üîç Purpose**:
Attempts to find personal emails using the name + company domain.

**üì§ Output**: Email (if public), sometimes with confidence score.

---

## üìë **5. Store Everything in Google Sheets**

---

### üßæ `Store Results in Google Sheet`

**üîß Node Type**: Google Sheets (Append Row)
**üß† Purpose**:
Saves:

* Job title
* Description
* Client Name
* Person/Company
* LinkedIn Profile
* Scraped Info
* Emails

**üìö Why It‚Äôs Gold**:
You now have a **personal CRM of Upwork clients** to reach out to directly or research further.

---

## üåü **Summary of Benefits**

| ‚úÖ Feature              | üí° Benefit                            |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------- |
| Fully automated        | Save hours of manual research         |
| Uses AI                | No need to write complex regex or NLP |
| Phantombuster scraping | Get verified LinkedIn profiles        |
| Hunter.io              | Helps gather email leads              |
| Google Sheets          | Easy to filter, review, and manage    |

---

## üìå **Beginner Tips**

* üß™ Start with dummy job data and test just the first few nodes.
* üîë Always **secure your API keys** using environment variables or secrets.
* üß† Use **n8n‚Äôs execution log** to debug any failures.
* üßπ Add rate-limiting or error handling if APIs return errors or limits.

---

Would you like a Notion-ready documentation, downloadable PDF, or HTML guide for your team or clients?
